An '''iron chestplate''' is a variant of [[chestplate]] that is crafted from [[iron ingot]]s. It is the third-highest [[tier]] of chestplate, having higher armor points than [[Golden Chestplate|golden]] and [[chainmail chestplate]]s.

== Obtaining ==

=== Natural generation ===
Two [[armor stand]]s are found in each [[taiga village]] outdoor armory, one of them equipped with an iron chestplate.

=== Generated loot ===
{{LootChestItem|iron-chestplate,level-enchanted-iron-chestplate,level-enchanted-iron-chestplate-0-10}}

=== Mob loot ===
[[Zombie]]s, [[husk]]s, [[skeleton]]s, [[stray]]s, and [[bogged]] have a small chance to spawn [[Geared mobs|wearing armor]], which may include an iron chestplate. There is a 8.5% chance (9.5% with [[Looting]] I, 10.5% with Looting II and 11.5% with Looting III) for the mob to drop the chestplate they're wearing upon death unless they are spawned from an [[ominous trial spawner]]. The dropped chestplate is usually badly damaged, and may be [[enchanted]] with enchantment levels 5-19.

{{IN|bedrock}}, [[vindicator]]s and [[pillager]]s spawning in [[raid]]s have a 4.16% chance (5.128% on hard difficulty) to drop an iron chestplate. The dropped chestplate is usually badly damaged, and has a 50% chance of being [[enchanted]] with a random [[enchantment]].

=== Trading ===
{{Trade sources}}

== Usage ==
When worn, an iron chestplate provides {{armor|6}} [[armor points]].
=== Repairing ===
Two damaged iron chestplates can be combined through [[crafting]] or using the [[grindstone]]. The durability of the used iron chestplates are added together, plus an extra 5% durability. Both the crafting table and grindstone methods do not keep the enchantments of either chestplate.

{{Crafting|Damaged Iron Chestplate|Damaged Iron Chestplate
|Output = Iron Chestplate
|type = Combat
|showdescription = 1
|description = The durability of the two chestplates is added together, plus an extra 5% durability.
|ignoreusage = 1
}}
{{Grinding
|showdescription=1
|ingredients=2x Damaged [[Iron Chestplate]]
|Damaged Iron Chestplate
|Damaged Iron Chestplate
|Iron Chestplate
|description=The durability of the two chestplates is added together, plus an extra 5% durability.}}

==== Unit repair ====
{{Repairing
| head=1
| Damaged Iron Chestplate
| Damaged Iron Chestplate; Iron Ingot
| Iron Chestplate
| tail=1
}}

An iron chestplate can also be repaired in an [[anvil]] by adding [[iron ingot]]s, with each ingot restoring 25% the chestplates' maximum durability, rounded down. Two chestplates of the same tier can also be combined in an anvil. Both methods using the anvil preserves the chestplate's [[enchantment]]s.

=== Armor trimming ===
It is possible to upgrade armor with trims. This requires a [[smithing template]], a chestplate, and an ingot or crystal ([[iron ingot]], [[copper ingot]], [[gold ingot]], [[netherite ingot]], [[emerald]], [[redstone dust]], [[lapis lazuli]], [[amethyst shard]], [[nether quartz]], [[diamond]], or [[resin brick]]).

These trims have no effect on the gameplay or strength of the armor. 

{{Smithing
|head=1
|ingredients=Any Armor Trim +<br>Iron Chestplate +<br>Any Ingot/Crystal
|Any Armor Trim Smithing Template
